result.execSummary:
The defendant Lacey M Nissen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 11/4/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.   Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 33 days served; Huber privileges. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lacey M Nissen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per request of MCSD, duplicate Order to Cancel generated.

Defendant Lacey M Nissen in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Lacey M Nissen in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 33 days served; Huber privileges. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 11/4/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.   Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
FILED, ORDER TO PRODUCE FOR SENTENCING HEARING ON mAY 4, 2015 @ 3:00 PM IN BR6 SB RM 310
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE SENTENCING IN BRANCH 6.

Defendant Lacey M Nissen in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant picked up another case in Waukesha.   The Defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the Defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defense beleives the defendant is in custody in Waukesha.     Defendant does not appear.  Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM007948  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-12-2015

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court vacates the warrant.  Defendant has be charged with a new case in Waukesha.  State will be revoking the agreement.  Review hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
from Bucher Law Group, LLC, received and filed. lms
Corrected CCAP to reflect that defendant is a female.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Lacey M Nissen not in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Case was staffed.  Defendant has picked up a new charge.  State has spoke with Defense counsel, attorney Reyes-Cuevas, in requesting court issue a warrant.   Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Lacey M Nissen in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has completed intensive outpatient treatment and has tested negative.  Defendant needs to begin community service.    With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Lacey M Nissen in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.   Defendant recently tested negative and have been missing group and treatment.  Documentation of completed community service is needed.  Review hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Lacey M Nissen in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant is requesting a brief adjournment to present documentation of progress.   Defendant needs to complete community service.  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Lacey M Nissen in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has been discharged for treatment due to attendance.   Court needs dates and results of test.  Defendant is employed.  Defendant needs to begin community service.  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lacey M Nissen in court with attorney Rosemary R Cuevas.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant is in compliance with the agreement.  Review hearing scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lacey M Nissen in court with attorney Rosemary R Cuevas.  David T Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Review Hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.

Defendant Lacey M Nissen in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading  Review hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court appearance in Room 310 Safety Building on 3/11/14 @ 1:30pm
